captions.text:
How to tell when a parakeet is sick. When
a parakeet or any bird for that matter, gets

sick, they start getting lethargic, they're
going to sit in one area of the cage a lot.

They're going to puff their beaks up or their
feathers up make themselves look bigger, what

they're actually doing is trying to increase
their body warmth. The number one cause of

any kind of a sickness in a parakeet is going
to be cold temperatures. Remember these are

tropical birds. They need to be kept in at
least the 70's to be healthy. Any cold drafts

hitting them can cause them to get sick, respiratory
infections are very prevalent and can be very

detrimental to the bird. Of course always
keep your eye out for any discharge from the

nasal area or any discharge from the eyes.
You want to make sure that the animal isn't

bleeding anywhere, anything like that. These
are all important indicators for the health

of the parakeet. But the number one indicator
is lethargy and puffing them self up. If your

parakeet is doing that all the time, then
it's time to take him to the vet, he needs

to be looked at immediately. He could have
an upper respiratory infection or some other

sort of disease that could bring his life
to an end very soon. So make sure that if,

birds are very delicate, so make sure that
if you see any of these signs you do take

your bird to a proper vet and make sure you
have a vet already scoped out in the case

title: Pet Birds : How to Tell When a Parakeet is Sick

comments.text:
my died about 1 year ago because of sickness and when my mom bought, her 
nails were growing upside down 0.0 i know it seems weird but it was really 
growing wrong and she could not walk on my bed or sofa or something like 
that . and also she had a black big something like ball in front of her eye 
and while flying she could not  see wall (white wall) and was crushing . 
and then she stopped everything and was only eating and sleeping all day 
and i thought it was  because of the room (which was little dark) she 
thought that it was night but then she became more big and she was sitting 
all day with one leg up and then she fell down on ground and couldnt even 
stand and then she died... aand my sister cried. AND after that i learned 
everything about budgies (what can they eat,drink, how to cut their nails, 
how to choose cage,treats,even how to tell budgies age!) and lookin forward 
to buy another budgie.﻿
comments.author: girr rrl

comments.text:
I just got 2 parakeets yesterday from my aunt and I've noticed they puff up 
their feathers a lot(please don't yell at me, I just got them and I never 
took care of them), they both sit in one spot too but they'll go on the 
bars of the cage and chew on their toys(which are all around the cage) 
Please tell me if that's good or bad!

Also, yesterday after I got them I let them chill for about 30 minutes but 
my mom noticed the males nails were kinda long(not super long tho) so she 
opened the cage door and he came out. So he flew to this blanket that 
covers his cage and sat there for about 10 minutes. My female Sunkist 
couldn't find and she started looking all over her cage and calling for 
him. She flew out but when she couldn't find anything to land on she'd just 
crash. It made me feel so horrible because I can't control her or him and 
they're not tame. We spent 2 hours trying to catch them and they're both 
fine but I was wondering why they'd just crash? ﻿
comments.author: xx Alaya xx

comments.text:
+Hodo Ali Thanks, I've spent enough time with them to where they're not 
super scared and I made some perches and glued them in the corners of the 
walls of my room so they have a lot of places to land. Also, I'd NEVER grab 
at them(I'm very gentle and cautious with any animal).
comments.author: xx Alaya xx

comments.text:
+Alaya Basinger hi alaya! the reason why they crashed was because they are 
new to the environment. plus they tend to land on high places. So if they 
cant find it they will usually land on the floor.. and if they are not use 
to the room or place they will tend to hit things. This is okay and its 
normal. just make sure you release them in a smaller room that is some what 
bird safe. and if you just got them, please give them time to get use to 
the area first. dont let them out nor try to grab them. allow them to get 
use to you and the place without constantly having to watch out for 
danger.. Good Luck!!!!!!
comments.author: Hodo Ali

comments.text:
birds puffing up is normal they do it wen they r comfortable, but if ur 
bird is lazy and never moves and is always puffed up and dosnt make a sound 
and if they look tired then ther is something wrong with ur bird, u can 
always check ther poop and check ther butthole if ther poop is watery and 
the poop color is not solid black and white then ther is something wrong 
with ur bird and if ther is a lot of poop on ur bird's butthole then ur 
bird is sick
hope tht helps

comments.text:
@hamsters56789 I'm sure he was talking Fahrenheit. 70 degrees in a house or 
building isn't that warm, to be honest. As compared to walking outside in 
the sun and it being 70, it feels blistering. [In fahrenheit. That is, I'm 
not sure how it measures over to Celcius.] There's a lot to owning a bird, 
it's far different then a cat, dog, hamster, etc. Message me if you need to 
know anything particular, I've had three thus far.
